claim-text.content: 1. A method for analyzing at least one constituent of a biologic fluid sample quiescently residing within an analysis chamber defined by a first panel and a second panel, and which sample is mixed with at least one colorant that is operable to reside within the constituent and emit fluorescent light upon exposure to predetermined first wavelengths of light, the method comprising the steps of:
illuminating at least a portion of the sample containing the constituent at one or more first wavelengths in a constant manner for a period of time;

imaging the at least a portion of the sample at discrete points in time during the period, including producing image signals at the discrete points in time, which signals are indicative of fluorescent emissions from colorant residing within the constituent;

determining one or more fluorescent emission values associated with the colorant residing within constituent using the image signals from the discrete points in time, and a rate of change for the fluorescent emission values between a plurality of the discrete points in time; and
analyzing the constituent using the determined rate of change of the fluorescent emission values for the constituent.

claim.body: the analyzing step includes determining a characteristic of the constituent.

content: 2. The method of
, wherein the analyzing step includes determining a characteristic of the constituent.

claim.body: the characteristic is an age of the constituent.

content: 3. The method of
, wherein the characteristic is an age of the constituent.
4. The method of
, wherein the at least one constituent includes a first constituent and a second constituent;

claim-text.content: wherein the step of determining one or more fluorescent emission values includes determining the one or more fluorescent emission values from the colorant residing within the first constituent and from the second constituent using the image signals from the discrete points in time, and a rate of change for the fluorescent emission values between a plurality of the discrete points in time for each of the first constituent and the second constituent; and
analyzing the first constituent and the second constituent using the determined rate of change of the fluorescent emission values for the respective constituent.

claim.body: the first constituent and the second constituent are a same type of constituent.

content: 5. The method of
, wherein the first constituent and the second constituent are a same type of constituent.

claim.body: the analyzing step includes determining a characteristic of the first constituent and the second constituent.

content: 6. The method of
, wherein the analyzing step includes determining a characteristic of the first constituent and the second constituent.

claim.body: the characteristic is an age of the respective constituent.

content: 7. The method of
, wherein the characteristic is an age of the respective constituent.

claim.body: the biologic fluid sample is substantially undiluted whole blood.

content: 8. The method of
, wherein the biologic fluid sample is substantially undiluted whole blood.

claim.body: the first and second constituents are selected from the group consisting of white blood cells and particulates.

content: 9. The method of
, wherein the first and second constituents are selected from the group consisting of white blood cells and particulates.

claim.body: the first and second constituents are each types of white blood cells.

content: 10. The method of
, wherein the first and second constituents are each types of white blood cells.

claim.body: the first constituents and the second constituents are selected from the group consisting of eosinophils, neutrophils, and basophils.

content: 11. The method of
, wherein the first constituents and the second constituents are selected from the group consisting of eosinophils, neutrophils, and basophils.

claim.body: the first and second constituents are each types of particulates.

content: 12. The method of
, wherein the first and second constituents are each types of particulates.

claim.body: the first and second particulates are selected from a group consisting of platelets and hematoparasites.

content: 13. The method of
, wherein the first and second particulates are selected from a group consisting of platelets and hematoparasites.

claim.body: the one or more one or more values representative of fluorescent emission from the constituent are determined on a per pixel basis.

content: 14. The method of
, wherein the one or more one or more values representative of fluorescent emission from the constituent are determined on a per pixel basis.

claim.body: the steps of determining one or more fluorescent emission values and analyzing the constituent are performed using one or more processors adapted to process the image signals.

content: 15. The method of
, wherein the steps of determining one or more fluorescent emission values and analyzing the constituent are performed using one or more processors adapted to process the image signals.

claim.body: the step of determining one or more fluorescent emission values associated with the colorant includes determining fluorescent emission values at different wavelengths.

content: 16. The method of
, wherein the step of determining one or more fluorescent emission values associated with the colorant includes determining fluorescent emission values at different wavelengths.

claim-text.content: 17. An apparatus for analyzing a blood sample, comprising:
a chamber adapted to quiescently hold the sample;
an illuminator operable to illuminate at least a portion of the sample containing a constituent, along one or more fluorescent excitation wavelengths in a constant manner for a period of time;

an image dissector operable to image the at least a portion of the sample at discrete points in time during the period, and produce image signals representative of fluorescent emissions from the constituent at the discrete points in time; and

an analysis device adapted to determine one or more fluorescent emission values for the constituent quiescently disposed within the sample using the image signals at the discrete points in time, and a rate of change for the fluorescent emission values between the discrete points in time, and adapted analyze the constituent using the determined rate of change of the fluorescent emission values for the constituent.

claim.body: the constituent is selected from the group consisting of white blood cells and particulates.

content: 18. The apparatus of
, wherein the constituent is selected from the group consisting of white blood cells and particulates.

claim.body: the analysis device is operable to determine a characteristic of the constituent, using the image signals at the discrete points in time, and the rate of change for the fluorescent emission values between the discrete points in time.

content: 19. The apparatus of

, wherein the analysis device is operable to determine a characteristic of the constituent, using the image signals at the discrete points in time, and the rate of change for the fluorescent emission values between the discrete points in time.

claim.body: the characteristic is an age of the constituent.

content: 20. The apparatus of
, wherein the characteristic is an age of the constituent.
